description: From Lombard pellagra, probably from Latin pellis (“skin”) + lombard -agra (fem. "sour").

entries.meaning: (pathology) A disease characterised by skin lesions and mental confusion, primarily caused by a niacin deficiency. [from 19th c.]
examples: In 1755 the French physician Gaspar Casal (1680–1759) published an account of pellagra, then a new disease in Spain.
